results.title: Lisinopril. A review of its pharmacology and use in the management of the complications of diabetes mellitus.
results.text_hl: As shown by the EUCLID (EUrodiab Controlled trial of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@Insulin-Dependent Diabetes@@@) trial, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ is also renoprotective in normotensive @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@IDDM@@@ and microalbuminuria.

results.title: Lisinopril inhibited the progression of renal albumin excretion in patients with insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus.

results.title: High normo- or low microalbuminuria: basis for intervention in insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus.
results.text_hl: In a double blind study, normotensive @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@IDDM@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with moderate microalbuminuria (20 to 70 micrograms/min) were randomized to either @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (20 mg once a day, N = 12) or placebo (N = 10) for two years.

citations.NLM: Poulsen PL, Ebbehøj E, Hansen KW, Mogensen CE. High normo- or low microalbuminuria: basis for intervention in insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus. Kidney Int Suppl. 1997 Dec;63():S15-8. PMID: 9407413

results.title: Effects of lisinopril and nifedipine on the progression to overt albuminuria in IDDM patients with incipient nephropathy and normal blood pressure. The Italian Microalbuminuria Study Group in IDDM.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: Our data show that both @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@ are effective in delaying the occurrence of macroalbuminuria in normotensive @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@IDDM@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with MA.

results.title: Effects of nisoldipine and lisinopril on left ventricular mass and function in diabetic nephropathy.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: To compare the effects of the @CHEMICAL_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002118 @@@calcium@@@ channel blocker, @CHEMICAL_Nisoldipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015737 @@@nisoldipine@@@, and the @GENE_AP2B1 @GENE_163 @@@ACE@@@ inhibitor, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, on left ventricular mass (LVM) and systolic function in @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@type 1 diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Diabetic_Nephropathies @DISEASE_MESH:D003928 @@@diabetic nephropathy@@@.
